alert.note: Alert for Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 1:52PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Warren, southeastern Monroe and northeastern Northampton Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 152 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pen Argyl, or 14 miles north of Easton, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... East Stroudsburg, Bangor, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Belfast, East Bangor, Stormville, Brodheadsville, Saylorsburg, Analomink, Delaware Water Gap, Columbia, Stroudsburg, Roseto, Portland, Arlington Heights, Shawnee, Marshalls Creek and Bartonsville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 306 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northwestern New Jersey...and eastern and northeastern Pennsylvania.
